name: Facebook
reason: Zuckerberg killed fact-checking, dined at Mar-a-Lago, and donated $1M to the inauguration. Your data is their product. Take it back.

alternative.name: Bluesky
alternative.description: Decentralized, no algorithm manipulation, no billionaire owner

name: Instagram
reason: Same company, same Zuckerberg, same complicity. Your attention is their revenue. Cut them off.

alternative.name: Pixelfed
alternative.description: Decentralized, ad-free photo sharing. No algorithm, no ads, no Meta.

name: Threads
reason: Meta's Twitter clone. Same Zuckerberg, same data harvesting, same complicity. Bluesky exists.

name: TikTok
reason: An algorithm designed to keep you scrolling while the world burns. Reclaim your time.

alternative.name: Your free time
alternative.description: You'll be amazed what you do with an extra hour a day

name: X (formerly Twitter)
reason: Musk runs a federal department now. Every post, like, and view gives him leverage. Walk away.

alternative.name: Bluesky
alternative.description: Where most of Twitter's best users went. Open protocol, no Musk.

name: Spotify
reason: Joe Rogan got $250M. Artists get fractions of a penny. Leadership stays silent. The free tier still works.

alternative.name: Tidal
alternative.description: Artist-owned, better payouts to musicians, high-quality audio.

name: Amazon Prime
reason: Bezos owns the Washington Post and met with Trump. Prime funds union-busting and political access. End it.

alternative.name: Your local library + Bookshop.org
alternative.description: Library for free, Bookshop.org to support indie bookstores when you buy.

name: Kindle Unlimited
reason: Amazon's book subscription locks you into their ecosystem. Libraries are free and don't fund union-busting.

alternative.name: Libby + your library card
alternative.description: Free ebooks and audiobooks from your local library via the Libby app.

name: Prime Video
reason: Standalone Prime Video still funds Bezos. Cancel and switch to indie streaming.

alternative.name: Kanopy + Criterion Channel
alternative.description: Kanopy is free with a library card. Criterion Channel is $11/mo for the best films.

name: Amazon Music Unlimited
reason: Amazon Music funds the same empire. Switch to services that pay artists fairly.

alternative.name: Tidal
alternative.description: Better payouts to musicians, high-quality audio. Artists actually get paid.

name: Audible
reason: Audible is Amazon. Your audiobook habit funds Bezos. Libby has free audiobooks from your library.

alternative.name: Libby + Libro.fm
alternative.description: Libby for free library audiobooks. Libro.fm supports indie bookstores.

name: ChatGPT
reason: Sam Altman made the pilgrimage to Mar-a-Lago. OpenAI spends millions lobbying in DC. You don't have to fund it.

alternative.name: Ollama
alternative.description: Run open-source models locally with Ollama.

name: Paramount+
reason: Paramount's leadership plays it safe while democracy burns. Your subscription funds their silence.

alternative.name: Kanopy
alternative.description: Free with your library card. Quality content, no corporate silence.

name: Peacock
reason: Comcast owns NBC and plays both sides. Your monthly fee funds their access game.

alternative.name: Kanopy + Hoopla
alternative.description: Free with your library card. No Comcast money.

name: YouTube
reason: Google's CEO met with Trump and stays quiet while cashing your checks. The free tier still worksâ€”just with ads.

alternative.name: YouTube Free + uBlock Origin
alternative.description: Free tier with an ad blocker. Same content, no money to Google.

name: Gemini
reason: Same Pichai, same Google. Free tier or open-source alternatives work fine.

alternative.name: Gemini Free or Ollama
alternative.description: Free tier still works. Or run open-source models locally with Ollama.

name: Grok (xAI)
reason: Musk's AI trained on X data. Same Musk who runs DOGE. Your subscription funds his political machine.

alternative.name: Ollama
alternative.description: Run open-source models locally. No Musk.

name: Perplexity AI
reason: VC-funded AI search backed by Jeff Bezos and Nvidia. The billionaire money runs deep.

alternative.name: Ollama + SearXNG
alternative.description: Local AI plus private search. No VC money, no tracking.
